lessons.title: Fitting a Line to Data

standard_details.description: Given a scatter plot with a linear association, informally fit a straight line.

objectives: Draw a line of best fit by hand
Understand the purpose of a trend line
Balance points above and below the line
examples: Fit a line to height vs foot length data
Draw trend line through study time vs grade scatter plot
Compare different student-drawn lines of fit
common_misconceptions: Thinking the line must pass through specific points
Making the line too steep or flat
real_world_applications: Predicting future sales from past data

lessons.title: Using Lines of Fit for Predictions

standard_details.description: Given a scatter plot with a linear association, informally fit a straight line.

objectives: Use a line of fit to make predictions
Interpolate and extrapolate from trend lines
Understand limitations of predictions
examples: Predict test score for 5 hours of study using fitted line
Estimate missing data point using trend line
Extrapolate future value from existing pattern
common_misconceptions: Extrapolating too far from data range

lessons.title: Data Analysis Review

standard_details.description: Develop an understanding of the patterns and relationships in bivariate data.

objectives: Construct appropriate graphs for data
Describe patterns and correlations
Fit lines and make predictions
key_concepts: All data analysis concepts from MA.8.DP.1.1-1.3
examples: Complete data analysis projects
Mixed practice with real-world data sets
Graph interpretation and prediction
real_world_applications: Complete statistical analysis of real-world relationships

lessons.title: Sample Spaces and Tree Diagrams

standard_details.description: Determine the sample space for a repeated experiment.

objectives: Define sample space
List all possible outcomes of repeated experiments
Create tree diagrams for repeated experiments
examples: Find sample space for flipping a coin twice
List outcomes for rolling a die and flipping a coin
Create tree diagram for three coin flips
real_world_applications: Planning all possible scenarios in decision-making

lessons.title: Sample Spaces with Multiple Experiments

standard_details.description: Determine the sample space for a repeated experiment.

objectives: Find sample spaces for complex repeated experiments
Use multiplication principle to count outcomes
Organize outcomes systematically
examples: Sample space for rolling two dice
Outcomes for choosing from multiple categories
Calculate total outcomes using multiplication
common_misconceptions: Adding instead of multiplying outcome counts
Not accounting for order when it matters

lessons.title: Introduction to Theoretical Probability

standard_details.description: Determine the theoretical probability of an event related to a repeated experiment.

objectives: Define theoretical probability
Calculate probability as favorable/total outcomes
Express probability as fraction, decimal, and percent
examples: Find P(heads) when flipping a coin twice
Calculate P(sum of 7) when rolling two dice
Determine P(both red) when drawing marbles with replacement
common_misconceptions: Confusing number of outcomes with probability
Thinking probability can be greater than 1

lessons.title: Probability of Compound Events

standard_details.description: Determine the theoretical probability of an event related to a repeated experiment.

objectives: Find probability of compound events
Use sample spaces to calculate probabilities
Determine complementary probabilities
examples: Find P(at least one head) in three coin flips
Calculate P(no 6) when rolling a die twice
Determine P(same color) when spinning two spinners

lessons.title: Real-World Probability Applications

standard_details.description: Solve real-world problems involving probabilities related to single or repeated experiments, including making predictions based on theoretical probability.

objectives: Apply probability to real-world contexts
Make predictions based on theoretical probability
Calculate expected outcomes
examples: Predict number of heads in 100 coin flips
Calculate expected wins in a carnival game
Determine likelihood of weather events
common_misconceptions: Not scaling probability to number of trials

lessons.title: Advanced Real-World Probability

standard_details.description: Solve real-world problems involving probabilities related to single or repeated experiments, including making predictions based on theoretical probability.

objectives: Solve multi-step probability problems
Compare theoretical predictions to real results
Evaluate fairness of games and contests
examples: Determine if a game is fair based on probabilities
Solve complex real-world probability scenarios
Make informed decisions using probability
common_misconceptions: Not considering all possible outcomes in complex scenarios
Thinking equal prizes mean fair game

lessons.title: Probability Unit Review

standard_details.description: Develop an understanding of probability.

objectives: Determine sample spaces
Calculate theoretical probabilities
Solve real-world probability problems
examples: Mixed probability practice
Complex real-world scenarios
Probability project work
real_world_applications: Complete probability analysis in authentic contexts

lessons.title: Introduction to Pythagorean Theorem

standard_details.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve mathematical and real-world problems involving unknown side lengths in right triangles.

objectives: Identify right triangles and their parts
State the Pythagorean Theorem (a² + b² = c²)
Find the hypotenuse given two legs
examples: Find c when a = 3 and b = 4
Calculate hypotenuse of a 5-12 right triangle
Solve for c when a = 8 and b = 15
common_misconceptions: Confusing which side is the hypotenuse
Not taking the square root at the end
real_world_applications: Finding diagonal distance across a field

lessons.title: Finding Legs with Pythagorean Theorem

standard_details.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve mathematical and real-world problems involving unknown side lengths in right triangles.

objectives: Find a leg when given hypotenuse and other leg
Rearrange Pythagorean Theorem (a² = c² - b²)
Solve real-world problems for legs
key_concepts: a² = c² - b² or b² = c² - a²
examples: Find a when b = 12 and c = 13
Calculate missing leg when c = 10 and a = 6
Determine height of a structure using Pythagorean Theorem
real_world_applications: Finding height of a building using shadow

lessons.title: Pythagorean Theorem for Distance

standard_details.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve mathematical and real-world problems involving the distance between two points in a coordinate plane.

objectives: Find distance between two points on coordinate plane
Recognize distance as hypotenuse of right triangle
Apply distance formula
examples: Find distance between (1, 2) and (4, 6)
Calculate distance from origin to (3, 4)
Determine length of segment with endpoints (-2, 1) and (3, 5)

lessons.title: Triangle Inequality Theorem

standard_details.description: Use the Triangle Inequality Theorem to determine if a triangle can be formed from a given set of sides.

objectives: State Triangle Inequality Theorem
Check if three lengths can form a triangle
Explain why certain combinations don't work
key_concepts: Sum of two sides > third side
examples: Can sides 3, 4, 5 form a triangle?
Determine if 2, 3, 10 can be triangle sides
Check if 5, 7, 9 form a valid triangle
real_world_applications: Construction - ensuring triangular frames are possible

lessons.title: Angle Relationships

standard_details.description: Solve mathematical problems involving the relationships of the angles formed by a transversal and a pair of parallel lines.

objectives: Identify angle relationships with parallel lines and transversal
Find corresponding, alternate interior, and alternate exterior angles
Solve for unknown angles using angle relationships
examples: Find missing angles when parallel lines are cut by transversal
Identify angle pairs and their relationships
Solve for x in parallel line diagrams
common_misconceptions: Not recognizing when lines are parallel
Mixing up equal vs supplementary relationships

lessons.title: Triangle Angle Sum

standard_details.description: Develop and use formulas for the sums of the interior angles of regular polygons by decomposing them into triangles.

objectives: Prove triangle angle sum is 180°
Find missing angles in triangles
Apply triangle angle sum to solve problems
key_concepts: Using algebra to find unknown angles
examples: Find missing angle when two angles are 50° and 70°
Solve for x when angles are x, 2x, and 3x
Calculate third angle given two angles
common_misconceptions: Forgetting to check if answer is reasonable

lessons.title: Polygon Angle Sums

standard_details.description: Develop and use formulas for the sums of the interior angles of regular polygons by decomposing them into triangles.

objectives: Decompose polygons into triangles
Derive formula: (n-2) × 180°
Find sum of interior angles for any polygon
examples: Find angle sum of hexagon
Calculate interior angle sum of octagon
Determine each angle in regular pentagon
common_misconceptions: Confusing interior angle sum with one angle measure

lessons.title: Geometry Review - Pythagorean Theorem and Angles

standard_details.description: Develop an understanding of relationships among geometric figures.

objectives: Apply Pythagorean Theorem to various problems
Use Triangle Inequality Theorem
Solve angle problems with parallel lines and polygons
examples: Mixed practice problems
Real-world geometry applications
Multi-step geometry problems

lessons.title: Identifying Transformations

standard_details.description: Given a preimage and image generated by a single transformation, identify the transformation that describes the relationship.

objectives: Identify translations, reflections, rotations, and dilations
Distinguish between rigid and non-rigid transformations
Describe transformations in words
examples: Identify if a figure was translated, reflected, or rotated
Recognize dilation from size change
Describe transformation from preimage to image

lessons.title: Dilations and Scale Factors

standard_details.description: Given a preimage and image generated by a single dilation, identify the scale factor that describes the relationship.

objectives: Define scale factor
Calculate scale factor from preimage and image
Distinguish enlargements from reductions
examples: Find scale factor when image is twice the preimage
Determine k when figure is reduced to half size
Calculate scale factor from corresponding side lengths
common_misconceptions: Confusing scale factor with actual lengths

lessons.title: Applying Transformations and Similar Triangles

standard_details.description: Apply a single transformation to a figure and represent the transformation with a written description and with coordinates. / Describe and apply the effect of a single transformation on two-dimensional figures using coordinates and the coordinate plane. Given a preimage and an image, describe a sequence of transformations that maps the preimage to the image.

objectives: Apply transformations on coordinate plane
Write coordinate rules for transformations
Use similarity to solve triangle problems
Sequence multiple transformations
examples: Apply a translation to triangle ABC
Reflect a figure across x-axis
Dilate a shape with center at origin
Find missing sides in similar triangles
Describe sequence of transformations
